member.name: T:OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPModeratedStateVariable
member.summary:
This object derives from UPnPStateVariable. This implementation adds the ability to moderate the event, as defined in UPnP A/V.
Simply set the Accumulator and Moderation Period.

member.name: T:OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPStateVariable
member.summary:
A UPnPStateVariable
This object is the "meat" of UPnP. It is used to event the current state of a variable to subscribed control points. This object is also used by control points to determine the types of the parameters for a given action.
member.exception:
This gets thrown if an attempt is made to remove a UPnPState variable when something is dependent on it. Possible reasons include:
An action has a related state variable pointing to this The association list in this object, is referencing an existing action
This gets thrown if a value is passed that is out of the range specified by this object

member.name: F:OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPStateVariable.SendEvent
member.summary: Bool indicating if this UPnPStateVariable is evented

member.name: M:OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPStateVariable.#ctor(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Constructs a UPnPStateVariable
This constructor creates a UPnPStateVariable with the given name, and assigns it the given default value. This UPnPStateVariable will be evented, unless otherwise modified.

member.name: M:OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPStateVariable.#ctor(System.String,System.Object,System.String[])
member.summary:
Constructs a UPnPStateVariable
The UPnPStateVariable is created with the given name, assigned the given default value, and given the given AllowedValueList.

member.name: T:OpenSource.UPnP.LockRMWO
member.summary:
This is a synchronization object (that should have a better name but I couldn't think of the real term).
In any case, it allows many simultaneous "read" operations but only write operation at any time.
The read and write operations should span large chunks of code. It may not be efficient to use this class if you want to guard really small code blocks. This class uses a Mutex, which forces a small degree of blocking for any operation, including read ops.
If a client issues a write op: - all subsequent read/write ops are blocked/queued, - write op blocks until all existing read-ops complete, - write op blocks until all previous write ops complete - then the write op is done - then read or write ops continue
If a client issues a read op: - all subsequent write ops are blocked - read op blocks until write op is complete - read op blocks until

member.name: M:OpenSource.UPnP.LockRMWO.StartRead
member.summary:
Starts a read operation if no write operations are being serviced. Otherwise, the write operation is queued.
A successive write operation is queued until all pending read operations are considered complete through EndRead().
A successive read operation is allowed to execute simultaneously.

member.name: M:OpenSource.UPnP.LockRMWO.EndRead
member.summary: Finishes a read operation and allows write operations to begin if no read operations are still being serviced.

member.name: M:OpenSource.UPnP.LockRMWO.StartWrite
member.summary:
Starts a write operation if no read ops are being serviced. Queues a write operation if a read is still in progress.
A successive write operation is queued until all pending read/write operations are considered completed.
A successive read operation is queued.

member.name: M:OpenSource.UPnP.LockRMWO.EndWrite
member.summary: Completes a write operation

member.name: T:OpenSource.UPnP.NetworkInfo
member.summary: This class monitors local IP addresses and sends events when a address is added or removed. Generally, this class should be created and GetLocalAddresses() should be used to query all currently available interfaces. Subsequent changes to the list will trigger events;

member.name: M:OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPSmartControlPoint.#ctor
member.summary: Keep track of all UPnP devices on the network

member.name: M:OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPSmartControlPoint.#ctor(OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPSmartControlPoint.DeviceHandler)
member.summary: Keep track of all UPnP devices on the network. The user can expect the OnAddedDeviceSink delegate to immidiatly be called for each device that is already known.
member.param: Delegate called when a UPnP device is detected

member.name: M:OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPSmartControlPoint.#ctor(OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPSmartControlPoint.DeviceHandler,System.String)
member.summary: Keep track of all UPnP devices on the network. The user can expect the OnAddedDeviceSink delegate to immidiatly be called for each device that is already known.

member.name: M:OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPSmartControlPoint.#ctor(OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPSmartControlPoint.DeviceHandler,OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPSmartControlPoint.ServiceHandler,System.String[])
member.summary:
Keep track of all UPnP devices on the network. The user can expect the OnAddedDeviceSink or OnAddedServiceSink delegate to immidiatly be called for each device that is already known.
if multiple filters are supplied, the results will be that of the parent device which satisfies all the search criteria.
member.param: Array of strings, which represent the search criteria

member.name: M:OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPSmartControlPoint.#ctor(OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPSmartControlPoint.DeviceHandler,OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPSmartControlPoint.ServiceHandler,System.String)
member.summary: Keep track of all UPnP devices on the network. The user can expect the OnAddedDeviceSink delegate to immidiatly be called for each device that is already known that matches the filter.
member.param: Delegate called when a UPnP device is detected that match the filter
Sets the filter to UPnP devices that start with this string

member.name: T:OpenSource.UPnP.DelayedResponseException
member.summary: There are times when you wish to do asynchronous processing when dispatched from the UPnPService. If you call and give it a Unique handle, then throw this exception, then from any thread you can call to complete the transaction. This is useful if for example you need to query other services in order to complete the action.

member.name: T:OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPAlreadySubscribedException
member.summary: This exception gets thrown if you try to subscribe to a service, that you already subscribed to.

member.name: T:OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPInvokeException
member.summary: This gets thrown if an exception was thrown during an Invoke attempt

member.name: T:OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPCustomException
member.summary: This gets thrown if a SOAP Fault was returned during an invoke attempt.

member.name: T:OpenSource.UPnP.HTTPRequest
member.summary: This is a convenience class to facilitate HTTP communication. This class handles the creation and sending of requests with an object. HTTPRequest also allows you to pipeline requests, whether or not the server supports it, because that functionality is abstracted away, so even if pipelining is not supported, this object will serialize the requests, and open seperate sessions.

member.name: T:OpenSource.UPnP.UPnPInternalSmartControlPoint
member.summary: This class implements the real functionality of the UPnP Smart Control Point System. For performance raisons, we want all the instances of the Smart Control Point classes to be connected and re-use information to avoid as much un-necessary UPnP network traffic as possible. This internal class is only instanciated once and does all the work on behalf of all of the Smart Control Point objects.
